meanings.definition: A chemical element with properties between those of metals and nonmetals.
meanings.sent1: Some semimetals are used in electronic devices.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study semimetals to understand their unique characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The semimetals at the science fair were neither shiny like metals nor dull like nonmetals.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of semimetals was a bridge between the familiar world of metals and the mysterious realm of nonmetals.
meanings.sent5: The periodic table helps us identify semimetals based on their properties.

meanings.definition: Elements that have electrical conductivity between that of metals and nonmetals.
meanings.sent1: Semimetals conduct electricity better than nonmetals but not as well as metals.
meanings.sent2: The semimetals in the circuit play a crucial role in regulating the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The semimetals in the power grid were the unsung heroes of the electrical system.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electricity, semimetals are the middle children, balancing conductivity levels.
meanings.sent5: The semimetals' conductivity levels make them versatile in various electronic applications.
